I bought 6 videos from this man just over two years ago.  There were lots of
issues but none of them due to dishonesty on his part.  I had numerous very
cordial email exchanges with Don and he went to no end of trouble to ensure I
got my tapes.  They turned up in the end after a slow surface mail journey (my
request).  It's a long story but in short I would give Don the benefit of the
doubt and give him every chance to remedy whatever situation has occurred
outside his control.

Best regards,

Barry Thomas
(Melbourne, Australia)

----- Original Message ----- 
From: "sigp210" <sigp210@...>
To: <nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, September 14, 2005 4:28 AM
Subject: [nihontostudy] Don Myrna of Gaijin's Guide Videos


Apologies for bringing this here, but I was wondering if anyone has
any contact details besides the website email for Don Myrna of the
Gaijin's Guide series of videos?
A friend ordered the videos from him way back in February, and they
never arrived. Numerous false promises of replacements and various
excuses and invalid tracking numbers have left me thinking he is a
fraud or a conman that sometimes sends them, and sometimes doesn't.
Email comms have stopped, and he is avoiding all attempts to sort this
out. Some people have reported that they received theirs, but I have
found 3 other people that have never received their videos, and have
had similar excuses about the postal services etc.
I have exhausted all other options, and am fairly confident in my
theory, not just making blind accusations. Does anyone else have
similar experiences?
I would caution anyone else against dealing with him unless you are
certain you will receive your videos. He seems to con mainly
international buyers. Seems well known, (and even respected by some)
so not sure why the difficulties. 
Does anyone have a reliable alternate source for the videos?
Going to do what I have to, to get my friend sorted out. I pointed
them out to him, and helped with Paypal payment, so feel obligated to
assist.

Many thanks,
Brian
